required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of GlaxoSmithKline Biologicals' GSK2202083A Vaccine in Healthy Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Study of GlaxoSmithKline Biologicals' GSK2202083A Vaccine in Healthy Infants at 2, 4 and 12 Months of Age

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and immunogenicity of GSK Biologicals' GSK2202083 vaccine co-administered with Prevenar 13® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age and with Rotarix™ at 2 and 4 months of age.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-polyribosylribitol Phosphate (Anti-PRP) Above the Cut-offs.
primary_outcome.description: The anti-PRP antibody concentrations cut-off was ≥ 0.15 and ≥ 1.0 micrograms per milliliter (µg/mL). The results for Month 3 ≥ 0.15 µg/mL were the primary efficacy variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Neisseria Meningitidis Using Baby Rabbit Complement (rSBA-MenC) Antibodies Above the Cut-offs.
primary_outcome.description: The rSBA-MenC cut-offs were ≥ 1:8 and ≥ 1:128. The results for Month 3 ≥ 1:8 were the primary efficacy variables.

secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations were expressed as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs). The seroprotection reference cut-off values were ≥ 0.15 µg/mL and ≥ 1.0 µg/mL.
Titers were expressed as geometric mean titers (GMCs). The seropositivity reference cut-off values were ≥ 1:8 and ≥ 1:128.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-diphtheria (Anti-D) and Anti-tetanus (Anti-T) Antibodies Above the Cut-off.
secondary_outcome.description: The anti-D and anti-T antibody cut-off was ≥ 0.1 international units per milliliter (IU/mL).
Concentrations were expressed as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs). The reference cut-off value was ≥ 0.1 IU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-hepatitis B (Anti-HBs) Antibody Concentration Equal to or Above (≥) 10 and 100 Milli-International Units Per Milliliter (mIU/mL)
secondary_outcome.description: A decrease in the specificity of the anti-HB enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) had been observed in some studies for low levels of antibody (10-100 mIU/mL). All the available blood samples initially tested with ELISA were re-tested using the Chemi Luminescence Immuno Assay (CLIA) approved by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA). The table shows updated results following partial or complete retesting/reanalysis.

A decrease in the specificity of the anti-HB enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) had been observed in some studies for low levels of antibody (10-100 mIU/mL). All the available blood samples initially tested with ELISA were re-tested using the Chemi Luminescence Immuno Assay (CLIA) approved by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA). The table shows updated results following partial or complete retesting/reanalysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-poliovirus (Anti-polio) Types 1, 2 and 3 Above the Cut-off.
secondary_outcome.description: The anti-polio 1, 2 and 3 antibody concentrations cut-off value was ≥ 1:8.
Titers were expressed as geometric mean titers (GMTs). The reference cut-off value was ≥ 1:8.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number Subjects With Anti-pertussis Toxoid (Anti-PT), Anti-filamentous Haemagglutinin (Anti-FHA) and Anti-pertactin (Anti-PRN) Above the Cut-off.
secondary_outcome.description: The reference cut-off for anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN antibody concentrations was ≥ 5 enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) units per milliliters (EL.U/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentrations for Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN.
secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations were expressed as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs). The reference cut-off value was ≥ 5 EL.U/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Booster Response to Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN.
secondary_outcome.description: Booster response defined as: for initially seronegative subjects, antibody concentration ≥ 5 EL.U/mL at Month 11; for initially seropositive subjects: antibody concentration at Month 11 ≥ 2 fold the pre-vaccination antibody concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-pneumococcal (Anti-PNE) Serotypes Above the Cut-offs.
secondary_outcome.description: The anti-PNE antibody concentrations reference cut-offs were ≥ 0.2 and ≥ 0.05 micrograms per milliliter (µg/mL). The anti-PNE serotypes assessed were 1, 3, 4, 5, 6A, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19A, 19F and 23F.
Concentrations were expressed as geometric mean concentreations (GMCs). The reference cut-off value was ≥ 0.2 µg/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-PRP and rSBA-MenC Fold Increase Distribution.
secondary_outcome.description: The fold increase distribution cut-offs were: ≥2, ≥4, ≥6, ≥8 and ≥10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Solicited Local Symptoms.
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited local symptoms assessed were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of any local symptom regardless of intensity grade.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Solicited General Symptoms.
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited local symptoms assessed were drowsiness, irritability/fussiness, loss of appetite and fever [axillary temperature above (≥) 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = occurrence of any local symptom regardless of intensity grade.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within the 31-day (Days 0-30) follow up period after vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: An unsolicited AE is any AE (i.e. any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product) reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any = occurrence of an AE regardless of intensity grade or relationship to study vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Serious Adverse Events (SAEs).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (Month 0 to Month 11)
secondary_outcome.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that results in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, results in disability/incapacity or are a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subjects. Any SAE = any SAE regardless of assessment of relationship to study vaccination.

arm_group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of GSK2202083A vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The GSK2202083A and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and left sides of the thigh, respectively. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® and Menjugate® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The Infanrix hexa™ and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and upper left sides of the thigh, respectively and the Menjugate® vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the lower left thigh. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

intervention.description: 3 doses given at 2, 4 and 12 months of age
3 doses given at 2, 4 and 12 months of age

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who the investigator believes that their parent(s)/Legally Acceptable Representative(s) can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol.
- A male or female infant between, and including, 8 and 12 weeks at the time of the first vaccination.
- Born after a gestation period of 36 to 42 weeks inclusive.
- Written informed consent obtained from the parent(s), Legally Acceptable Representative(s) of the subject.
- Healthy subjects as established by medical history and clinical examination before entering into the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of any investigational or non-registered product other than the study vaccine(s) within 30 days preceding the first dose of study vaccine, or planned use during the study period.
- Chronic administration of immunosuppressants or other immune-modifying drugs since birth.
- Child in care.
- Administration of immunoglobulins and/or any blood products since birth or planned administration during the study period.
- Administration of a vaccine not foreseen by the study protocol within 30 days prior to randomisation, or planned administration from randomisation to the end of the study with the exception of inactivated influenza vaccines. The administration of diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, hepatitis B, poliomyelitis, Haemophilus influenzae type b, pneumococcal, rotavirus and/or MenC vaccines is not allowed at any time during the study period but other vaccines are allowed during the period from one day after study Visit 3 to 31 days before study Visit 4.
- Concurrently participating in another clinical study, at any time during the study period, in which the subject has been or will be exposed to an investigational or a non-investigational product.
- Evidence of previous diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, hepatitis B, poliomyelitis, Hib, pneumococcal, rotavirus and/or MenC vaccination or disease, including Hepatitis B virus vaccination at birth.
- History of seizures or progressive neurological disease.
- Subjects with history of intussusception or uncorrected congenital malformation of the gastrointestinal tract that would predispose for intussusception.
- Any confirmed or suspected immunosuppressive or immunodeficient condition, based on medical history and physical examination.
- History of any reaction or hypersensitivity likely to be exacerbated by any component of the vaccine(s).
- Major congenital defects or serious chronic illness.
The following condition is temporary or self-limiting, and a subject may be vaccinated once the condition has resolved if no other exclusion criteria is met:
- Current febrile illness or other moderate to severe illness within 24 hours of study vaccine administration.
- Current gastrointestinal infection.

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 480 subjects were enrolled in the study.

group.title: GSK2202083A Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of GSK2202083A vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The GSK2202083A and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and left sides of the thigh, respectively. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® and Menjugate® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The Infanrix hexa™ and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and upper left sides of the thigh, respectively and the Menjugate® vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the lower left thigh. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® and Menjugate® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Anti-polyribosylribitol Phosphate (Anti-PRP) Above the Cut-offs.
outcome.description: The anti-PRP antibody concentrations cut-off was ≥ 0.15 and ≥ 1.0 micrograms per milliliter (µg/mL). The results for Month 3 ≥ 0.15 µg/mL were the primary efficacy variables.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects, who complied with the protocol, for whom immunogenicity data were available and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component at the post-vaccination time points.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Anti-poliovirus (Anti-polio) Types 1, 2 and 3 Above the Cut-off.
outcome.description: The anti-polio 1, 2 and 3 antibody concentrations cut-off value was ≥ 1:8.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects, who complied with the protocol, for whom immunogenicity data were available and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component at the post-vaccination time points.

group.title: GSK2202083A Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of GSK2202083A vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The GSK2202083A and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and left sides of the thigh, respectively. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® and Menjugate® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The Infanrix hexa™ and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and upper left sides of the thigh, respectively and the Menjugate® vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the lower left thigh. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Anti-poliovirus (Anti-polio) Types 1, 2 and 3 Above the Cut-off.
measure.description: The anti-polio 1, 2 and 3 antibody concentrations cut-off value was ≥ 1:8.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects, who complied with the protocol, for whom immunogenicity data were available and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component at the post-vaccination time points.

outcome.title: Titers for Anti-polio 1, 2 and 3.
outcome.description: Titers were expressed as geometric mean titers (GMTs). The reference cut-off value was ≥ 1:8.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects, who complied with the protocol, for whom immunogenicity data were available and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component at the post-vaccination time points.

The GSK2202083A and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and left sides of the thigh, respectively. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® and Menjugate® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The Infanrix hexa™ and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and upper left sides of the thigh, respectively and the Menjugate® vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the lower left thigh. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

measure.title: Titers for Anti-polio 1, 2 and 3.
measure.description: Titers were expressed as geometric mean titers (GMTs). The reference cut-off value was ≥ 1:8.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects, who complied with the protocol, for whom immunogenicity data were available and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component at the post-vaccination time points.

outcome.title: Number Subjects With Anti-pertussis Toxoid (Anti-PT), Anti-filamentous Haemagglutinin (Anti-FHA) and Anti-pertactin (Anti-PRN) Above the Cut-off.
outcome.description: The reference cut-off for anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN antibody concentrations was ≥ 5 enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) units per milliliters (EL.U/mL).
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects, who complied with the protocol, for whom immunogenicity data were available and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component at the post-vaccination time points.

measure.title: Concentrations for Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN.
measure.description: Concentrations were expressed as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs). The reference cut-off value was ≥ 5 EL.U/mL.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects, who complied with the protocol, for whom immunogenicity data were available and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component at the post-vaccination time points.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With a Booster Response to Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN.
outcome.description: Booster response defined as: for initially seronegative subjects, antibody concentration ≥ 5 EL.U/mL at Month 11; for initially seropositive subjects: antibody concentration at Month 11 ≥ 2 fold the pre-vaccination antibody concentration
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects, who complied with the protocol, for whom immunogenicity data were available and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component at the post-vaccination time points.

The GSK2202083A and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and left sides of the thigh, respectively. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With a Booster Response to Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN.
measure.description: Booster response defined as: for initially seronegative subjects, antibody concentration ≥ 5 EL.U/mL at Month 11; for initially seropositive subjects: antibody concentration at Month 11 ≥ 2 fold the pre-vaccination antibody concentration
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects, who complied with the protocol, for whom immunogenicity data were available and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component at the post-vaccination time points.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Anti-pneumococcal (Anti-PNE) Serotypes Above the Cut-offs.
outcome.description: The anti-PNE antibody concentrations reference cut-offs were ≥ 0.2 and ≥ 0.05 micrograms per milliliter (µg/mL). The anti-PNE serotypes assessed were 1, 3, 4, 5, 6A, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19A, 19F and 23F.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects, who complied with the protocol, for whom immunogenicity data were available and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component at the post-vaccination time points.

An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

The Infanrix hexa™ and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and upper left sides of the thigh, respectively and the Menjugate® vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the lower left thigh. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

outcome.title: Anti-PRP and rSBA-MenC Fold Increase Distribution.
outcome.description: The fold increase distribution cut-offs were: ≥2, ≥4, ≥6, ≥8 and ≥10.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects, who complied with the protocol, for whom immunogenicity data were available and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component at the post-vaccination time points.

group.title: GSK2202083A Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of GSK2202083A vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

measure.title: Anti-PRP and rSBA-MenC Fold Increase Distribution.
measure.description: The fold increase distribution cut-offs were: ≥2, ≥4, ≥6, ≥8 and ≥10.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects, who complied with the protocol, for whom immunogenicity data were available and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component at the post-vaccination time points.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Solicited Local Symptoms.
outcome.description: Solicited local symptoms assessed were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of any local symptom regardless of intensity grade.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented and the symptom sheet completed.

group.title: GSK2202083A Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of GSK2202083A vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The GSK2202083A and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and left sides of the thigh, respectively. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® and Menjugate® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The Infanrix hexa™ and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and upper left sides of the thigh, respectively and the Menjugate® vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the lower left thigh. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Solicited Local Symptoms.
measure.description: Solicited local symptoms assessed were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of any local symptom regardless of intensity grade.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented and the symptom sheet completed.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Solicited General Symptoms.
outcome.description: Solicited local symptoms assessed were drowsiness, irritability/fussiness, loss of appetite and fever [axillary temperature above (≥) 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = occurrence of any local symptom regardless of intensity grade.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented and the symptom sheet completed.

group.title: GSK2202083A Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of GSK2202083A vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The GSK2202083A and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and left sides of the thigh, respectively. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® and Menjugate® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The Infanrix hexa™ and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and upper left sides of the thigh, respectively and the Menjugate® vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the lower left thigh. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Solicited General Symptoms.
measure.description: Solicited local symptoms assessed were drowsiness, irritability/fussiness, loss of appetite and fever [axillary temperature above (≥) 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = occurrence of any local symptom regardless of intensity grade.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented and the symptom sheet completed.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs).
outcome.description: An unsolicited AE is any AE (i.e. any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product) reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any = occurrence of an AE regardless of intensity grade or relationship to study vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: Within the 31-day (Days 0-30) follow up period after vaccination
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

group.title: GSK2202083A Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of GSK2202083A vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The GSK2202083A and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and left sides of the thigh, respectively. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® and Menjugate® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The Infanrix hexa™ and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and upper left sides of the thigh, respectively and the Menjugate® vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the lower left thigh. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs).
measure.description: An unsolicited AE is any AE (i.e. any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product) reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any = occurrence of an AE regardless of intensity grade or relationship to study vaccination.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Serious Adverse Events (SAEs).
outcome.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that results in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, results in disability/incapacity or are a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subjects. Any SAE = any SAE regardless of assessment of relationship to study vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (Month 0 to Month 11)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

group.title: GSK2202083A Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of GSK2202083A vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The GSK2202083A and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and left sides of the thigh, respectively. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® and Menjugate® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The Infanrix hexa™ and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and upper left sides of the thigh, respectively and the Menjugate® vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the lower left thigh. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Serious Adverse Events (SAEs).
measure.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that results in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, results in disability/incapacity or are a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subjects. Any SAE = any SAE regardless of assessment of relationship to study vaccination.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

reported_events.time_frame: Solicited symptoms: 8-day follow-up period after vaccination; unsolicited AEs: 31-day follow-up period after vaccination; SAEs: during the entire study period (Months 0-11).
reported_events.desc: For solicited local and general symptoms, the number of participants at risk included those from Total Vaccinated cohort who had the symptom sheet completed.

group.title: GSK2202083A Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of GSK2202083A vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The GSK2202083A and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and left sides of the thigh, respectively. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa Group
group.description: Subjects aged between and including 8 and 12 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine, co-administered with Prevenar 13® and Menjugate® at 2, 4 and 12 months of age. The Infanrix hexa™ and Prevenar 13® vaccines were administered intramuscularly into the right and upper left sides of the thigh, respectively and the Menjugate® vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the lower left thigh. An optional 2-dose vaccination with Rotarix™ was offered to the study participants at 2 and 4 months of age.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
